name: Seasoned Toasted Pumpkin Seeds
author: 12cosmo
summary: I whipped up this easy recipe after carving Halloween pumpkins and decided to add a little flavor to the seeds by using Chef Paul Prudhomme's® seasoning. You can use other mixes or you own choice of meat seasoning to make an equally delicious fall treat.
ingredients: 1 ½ teaspoons blackening seasoning (such as Chef Paul Prudhomme's Blackened Redfish Magic®)
2 cups raw pumpkin seeds, rinsed and dried
directions: Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C)
Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper
Combine butter, seasoning, and salt in a bowl
Add seeds; stir with a spoon until coated
Spread in a single layer on the baking sheets
Bake in the preheated oven, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and crisp, about 45 minutes
